title: The Morning Show's Kylie Gillies and Larry Emdur get their own Ooshies
text:
The Lion King Ooshie toys sent Australian grocery shoppers into a frenzy earlier this year.

And on Thursday, The Morning Show hosts Kylie Gillies and Larry Emdur couldn't believe it when they were gifted their very own Ooshies.

The pair were given the customised toys by the CEO of Headstart International, with Larry describing them as the 'rarest Ooshies in the world.'

'The rarest Ooshies in the world!' The Morning Show hosts Kylie Gillies and Larry Emdur got their own customised collectable toys on Thursday

'They've arrived in all their miniature glory!' exclaimed Kylie as she was presented the one-of-a kind toy.

The toys were miniature versions of Kylie and Larry, complete with capes and initials.

Kylie added with a laugh: 'Look, they have no mouths, so they don't speak!'

Would you look at that! The toys were miniature versions of Kylie and Larry, complete with capes and initials

What a gift! Back in August, Andrew Hendy, the CEO of Headstart International, promised the The Morning Show hosts their own Ooshies

Back in August, Andrew Hendy, the CEO of Headstart International, promised the The Morning Show hosts their own Ooshies.

'So up until now, the most rare Ooshie we've ever made is the furry Simba, 100 of them made,' Andrew said at the time.

'But what we want to show you we're going to release is the two new Ooshies - A Kylie Ooshie and a Larry one that have just been designed,' he added.

Rare: Before the Larry and Kylie Ooshies were created, the rarest was the fuzzy Mufasa Lion (pictured) from The Lion King Collection

The hosts couldn't believe what they were hearing.

Andrew added: 'This is for real these one-of-a-kind Larry, they will be the only ones available in the whole world.'

Before the Larry and Kylie Ooshies were created, the rarest was the fuzzy Mufasa Lion from The Lion King Collection.

Woolworths' Ooshie collector toys had sent shoppers into a frenzy earlier this year- with a rare toy even selling for over $100,000 (AU) on eBay at one point.
description: The Lion King Ooshie toys sent Australian grocery shoppers into a frenzy earlier this year.
authors: Ali Daher For Daily Mail Australia
